line_1: Skipp'd wanton, by her fleecy dam;
line_2: Stray'd from the fold, a sportive lamb

line_1: And not a little chide its thoughtless dam.
line_2: I meet a strolling kid, or bleating lamb,

line_1: And seek fresh Pasture for its bleating Dam,
line_2: Those were to feed and watch the tender Lamb,

line_1: He sternly guards it from the bleating Dam;
line_2: THUS, when a prowling Wolf has stol'n a Lamb,

line_1: So lost from Shepherd and its mourning Dam,
line_2: Through some lone Desart roves a stragg'ling Lamb;

line_1: Eyes with mute tenderness her distant dam,
line_2: Or seems to bleat, a Vegetable Lamb.
